member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Item.UseCache
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item should be cached in the printer's memory. An item cannot be cached if it's bound to some data source field through the DataField property. Default value is false
member.remarks: An item should be cached if it displays fixed or static content, for instance, items which display company logos, industry symbols, text messages, etc. By caching this kind of items, you will get a better printing performance.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Item.CacheItemId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID which will be assigned to the item in the cache. It must be a unique ID value for each item. The ID must be 1 to 8 alphanumeric [A-Z][0-9] characters long. If it's empty, then a random ID will be assigned automatically at runtime. Default value is an empty string

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Item.PrintAsGraphic
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the item's output is forced to be printed as a graphic. Default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the comments associated to this item. Default is an empty string.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Item.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an arbitrary string value that can be used to store custom information about this item. Default is an empty string.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Item.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this item cannot be inadvertently moved nor resized in the visual editor surface. Default is false.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode.TearOff
member.summary: After printing, the label advances so the web is over the tear bar. The label, with liner attached, can be torn off manually.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode.PeelOff
member.summary: After printing, the label moves forward and activates a Label Available Sensor. Printing stops until the label is manually removed from the printer.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode.Rewind
member.summary: The label and backing are rewound on an (optional) external rewind device. The next label is positioned under the printhead (no backfeed motion).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode.Applicator
member.summary: When used with an application device, the label move far enough forward to be removed by the applicator and applied to an item.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode.Cutter
member.summary: After printing, the media feeds forward and is automatically cut into predetermined lengths.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode.DelayedCutter
member.summary: The label is cut when printer receives a "CutLabel" command.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.TextItem.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input Mask for the text. Default value is an empty string

remarks.para: The length of the mask defines the number of characters to be formatted or masked. The mask is aligned to the characters in the target string starting with the right-most position.

The input mask can consist of the following characters:
D or d (Decimal numeric 0-9) H or h (Hexadecimal 0–9 plus a-f or A-F) O or o (Octal 0–7) A or a (Alphabetic A–Z or a–z) N or n (Alphanumeric 0–9 plus A–Z or a–z) % (Ignore character or skip)

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.TextItem.MaskIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask increment. The increment is the value to be added to the text on each label to be printed. Default value is an empty string

remarks.para: The default value for the increment is equivalent to a decimal value of 1 (one). The string is composed of any characters defined in the input mask. Invalid characters are assumed to be equal to a value of 0 (zero) in that characters position.

The increment value for alphabetic strings start with 'A' or 'a' as the zero placeholder. This means to increment an alphabetic character by one, a value of 'B' or 'b' must be in the increment string.
For characters that do not get incremented, the '%' character needs to be added to the increment string.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeItem.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input Mask for the value to encode. Default value is an empty string

remarks.para: The length of the mask defines the number of characters to be formatted or masked. The mask is aligned to the characters in the target string starting with the right-most position.

The input mask can consist of the following characters:
D or d (Decimal numeric 0-9) H or h (Hexadecimal 0–9 plus a-f or A-F) O or o (Octal 0–7) A or a (Alphabetic A–Z or a–z) N or n (Alphanumeric 0–9 plus A–Z or a–z) % (Ignore character or skip)

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeItem.MaskIncrement
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask increment. The increment is the value to be added to the value to encode on each label to be printed. Default value is an empty string

remarks.para: The default value for the increment is equivalent to a decimal value of 1 (one). The string is composed of any characters defined in the input mask. Invalid characters are assumed to be equal to a value of 0 (zero) in that characters position.

The increment value for alphabetic strings start with 'A' or 'a' as the zero placeholder. This means to increment an alphabetic character by one, a value of 'B' or 'b' must be in the increment string.
For characters that do not get incremented, the '%' character needs to be added to the increment string.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeItem.HideIfEmpty
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the barcode symbol is not displayed or printed if the value to encode is empty. Default value is false

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeItem.EanUpcMagnificationFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Magnification Factor for EAN/UPC barcodes. Default is 0 (Zero/Disabled).
member.remarks: EAN/UPC barcodes can be printed at various densities to accommodate a variety of printing and scanning processes. The significant dimensional parameter is X, the ideal width of a single module element. In Barcode Professional, this is specified with BarWidth property. For EAN/UPC symbols, the X-dimension at nominal size is 0.33 millimeter (= 0.013 inch). The "magnification factor" specifies the size of the barcode symbol as a whole by taking the nominal size as the 1.0 (100%) value.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BearerBarStyle.HorizontalRules

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.CodabarStartStopChar
member.summary: Specifies the start and stop character for Codabar symbology.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Code128
member.summary: Specifies the characters set to use in the Code 128 symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Code128.Auto
member.summary: Barcode Professional will automatically switch between code sets to encode the ASCII values.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Code128.A
member.summary: Barcode Professional will use the Char Set A which only supports ASCII values from 0 to 95

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Code128.B
member.summary: Barcode Professional will use the Char Set B which only supports ASCII values from 32 to 127

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Code128.C
member.summary: Barcode Professional will use the Char Set C which only supports pairs of digits

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.FIM
member.summary: Specifies the facing identification mark (FIM) pattern to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.FIM.A
member.summary: Used for Courtesy Reply Mail (CRM) and Meter Reply Mail (MRM) with a preprinted barcode.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.FIM.B
member.summary: Used for Business Reply Mail (BRM) without a preprinted BRM ZIP+4 barcode.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.FIM.C
member.summary: Used for Business Reply Mail (BRM) with a preprinted BRM ZIP+4 barcode.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.FIM.D
member.summary: Used only with information based indicia (IBI) postage.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.TelepenEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the Telepen Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.TelepenEncoding.Ascii
member.summary: Used to encode the full range of ASCII characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.TelepenEncoding.Numeric
member.summary: Used to encode pairs of numeric characters in double-density mode.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Supplement
member.summary: Specifies the supplement type to use with EAN and UPC symbologies.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Pdf417CompactionType
member.summary: Specifies the Compaction Type to apply for PDF417 symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Pdf417CompactionType.Auto
member.summary: It switches between Text, Binary and Numeric modes in order to minimize the number of codewords to be encoded.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Pdf417CompactionType.Binary
member.summary: It allows encoding all 256 possible 8-bit byte values. This includes all ASCII characters value from 0 to 127 inclusive and provides for international character set support.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Pdf417CompactionType.Text
member.summary: It allows encoding all printable ASCII characters, i.e. values from 32 to 126 inclusive in accordance with ISO/IEC 646, as well as selected control characters such as TAB (horizontal tab ASCII 9), LF (NL line feed, new line ASCII 10) and CR (carriage return ASCII 13).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Pdf417CompactionType.Numeric
member.summary: It allows encoding numeric data strings.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Pdf417ErrorCorrection
member.summary: Specifies the Error Correction Level to apply for PDF417 symbology.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MicroPdf417Version
member.summary: Specifies the MicroPDF417 version (a predefined combinations of numbers of columns and rows) to be generated.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DataMatrixEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the DataMatrix Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DataMatrixEncoding.Ascii
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains ASCII characters (0-127)

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DataMatrixEncoding.C40
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains numeric and upper case characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DataMatrixEncoding.Text
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains numeric and lower case characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DataMatrixEncoding.Base256
member.summary: Used to encode 8 bit values

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DataMatrixFormat
member.summary: Specifies the DataMatrix Format to use on that symbology.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the QR Code Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeEncoding.Numeric
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains numeric characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeEncoding.AlphaNumeric
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains alphanumeric characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeEncoding.Kanji
member.summary: Used to encode data that mainly contains Kanji characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeEncoding.Byte
member.summary: Used to encode 8 bit values

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeVersion
member.summary: Specifies the QR Code Version to use on that symbology. Version 1 (21 x 21 modules) to Version 40 (177 x 177 modules) increasing in steps of four modules per side.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Specifies the Error Correction Level to apply for QR Code symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.L
member.summary: Approx. 7% of codewords can be restored. Error correction level L is appropriate for high symbol quality and/or the need for the smallest possible symbol.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.M
member.summary: Approx. 15% of codewords can be restored. Level M is described as Standard level and offers a good compromise between small size and increased reliability.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Q
member.summary: Approx. 25% of codewords can be restored. Level Q is a High reliability level and suitable for more critical or poor print quality applications.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.H
member.summary: Approx. 30% of codewords can be restored. Level H offers the maximum achievable reliability.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MaxiCodeModes
member.summary: Specifies the MaxiCode modes.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MaxiCodeModes.Mode2
member.summary: Indicates the symbol contains a Structured Carrier Message with a numeric postal code (U.S.).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MaxiCodeModes.Mode3
member.summary: Indicates the symbol contains a Structured Carrier Message with an alphanumeric postal code (non-U.S.).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MaxiCodeModes.Mode4
member.summary: Indicates the symbol contains general-purpose data, protected by the standard error correction.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MaxiCodeModes.Mode5
member.summary: Indicates the symbol contains general-purpose data, protected by enhanced error correction (EEC).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MaxiCodeModes.Mode6
member.summary: Reserved for symbols used to program internal parameters of MaxiCode readers.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MicroQRCodeVersion
member.summary: Specifies the Micro QR Code Version to use on that symbology. Version M1 (11 x 11 modules) to Version M4 (17 x 17 modules) increasing in steps of two modules per side.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MsiChecksum
member.summary: Specifies the checksum method used for MSI barcodes

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeVersion
member.summary: Specifies the Han Xin Code Version to use on that symbology. Version 1 (23 x 23 modules) to Version 84 (189 x 189 modules) increasing in steps of two modules per side.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: Specifies the Error Correction Level to apply for Han Xin Code symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.L1
member.summary: Approx. 8% of codewords can be restored. L1 is appropriate for high symbol quality and/or the need for the smallest possible symbol.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.L2
member.summary: Approx. 15% of codewords can be restored. L2 is described as Standard level and offers a good compromise between small size and increased reliability.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.L3
member.summary: Approx. 23% of codewords can be restored. L3 is a High reliability level and suitable for more critical or poor print quality applications.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.L4
member.summary: Approx. 30% of codewords can be restored. L4 offers the maximum achievable reliability.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the Han Xin Code Encoding to use on that symbology.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.Numeric
member.summary: Used to encode data that contains numeric characters

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.Text
member.summary: Used to encode data from common symbols in ISO-8859-1

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.BinaryByte
member.summary: Used to encode 8 bit values

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.ChineseReg1
member.summary: Used to encode Common Chinese Characters in Region 1 i.e. characters whose first byte value is in the range of B0(HEX) to D7(HEX) and second byte value is in the range of A1(HEX) to FE(HEX), and characters whose first byte value is in the range of A1(HEX) to A3(HEX), and second byte value is in the range of A1(HEX) to FE(HEX), and characters whose byte values are in the range of A8A1(HEX) to A8C0(HEX).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.ChineseReg2
member.summary: Used to encode Common Chinese Characters in Region 2 i.e. characters whose first byte value is in the range of D8(HEX) to F7(HEX), and second byte value is in the range of A1(HEX) to FE(HEX).

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.GB18030Bytes2
member.summary: Used to encode the GB18030 2-byte region i.e. data from all characters (including the Common Chinese Characters in Regions 1 and 2) in GB18030 double-byte region.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.HanXinCodeEncoding.GB18030Bytes4
member.summary: Used to encode the GB18030 4-byte region i.e. characters whose first byte value is in the range of 81(HEX) to FE(HEX), and second byte value is in the range of 30(HEX) to 39(HEX), and third byte value is in the range of 81(HEX) to FE(HEX), and fourth byte value is in the range of 30(HEX) to 39(HEX).

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.ItfHmark
member.summary: Specifies the seven type of H marks for ITF symbology.

member.summary: Specifies what output type will be generated if an error occurs during barcode rendering.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeErrorBehavior.BlankImage
member.summary: A blank image will be rendered.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeErrorBehavior.ThrowException
member.summary: An Exception will be thrown.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils
member.summary: BarcodeUtils provides additional utilities related to barcode generation.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetAustraliaPostDomesticEParcelChecksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the checksum for an Australia Post Domestic eParcel code.
member.param: An Australia Post Domestic eParcel code.
member.returns: The checksum for an Australia Post Domestic eParcel code.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetModulus10Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the checksum Modulus 10 used by many barcode symbologies.
member.param: The code where the checksum will be computed on.
member.returns: The checksum Modulus 10.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetAustraliaPost4StateBarcodeChecksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the checksum (Reed Solomon codewords) for an Australia Post 4 State code.
member.param: An Australia Post 4 State code.
member.returns: The checksum (Reed Solomon codewords) for an Australia Post 4 State code.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetCode39Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the checksum Modulus 43 used by Code 39 barcode.
member.param: The Code 39 value.
member.returns: The checksum Modulus 43 used by Code 39 barcode.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetCode93Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the two-char checksum Modulus 47 used by Code 93 barcode.
member.param: The Code 93 value.
member.returns: The two-char checksum Modulus 47 used by Code 93 barcode.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetPpnChecksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the 2-digit checksum Modulus 97 used by IFA PPN barcode.
member.param: An IFA PZN8 code with or without 11 prefix.
member.returns: The 2-digit checksum Modulus 97 used by IFA PPN barcode.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetDhlAwbChecksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the checksum Modulus 7 used by DHL AWB barcode.
member.param: A DHL AWB 9-digit code.
member.returns: The checksum Modulus 7 used by DHL AWB barcode.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.BarcodeUtils.GetDeutschePostModulus11Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: It computes the Modulus 11 checksum used by Deutsche Post Code 128 Identcode
member.param: A valid 8-digit Deutsche Post Ident code.
member.returns: The checksum for a valid 8-digit Deutsche Post Ident code.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication
member.summary: Specifies information about printer communication like USB, Serial Port RS-232, Parallel Port (Centronics), and Network (Ethernet) connectivity.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.CommunicationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the printer communication type. Default value is USB

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.SerialPortName
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial port name, for example COM1. Default value is "COM1"

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.SerialPortBaudRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial port baud rate in bits per second. Default value is 9600

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.SerialPortParity
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial port parity-checking protocol. Default value is None

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.SerialPortStopBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial port standard number of stopbits per byte. Default value is One

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.SerialPortDataBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial port standard length of data bits per byte. Default value is 8

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.SerialPortFlowControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the handshaking protocol for serial port transmission of data. Default value is XOnXOff

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.ParallelPortName
member.summary: Gets or sets the parallel port name, for example LPT1. Default value is "LPT1"

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.NetworkIPAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the Internet Protocol (IP) address assigned to the printer. Default value is None
member.remarks: If the IP address is not specified i.e. it is IPAddress.None, then the PrinterName property of PrinterSettings class will be used as the Printer's Host Name.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.NetworkPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the port number assigned to the printer. Default value is 0

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.NetworkTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the network amount of time in milliseconds. Default value is 1500

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrinterCommunication.Stream
member.summary: Gets or sets System.IO.Stream object for writing printer commands to. It is used only if the CommunicationType property is set up to Stream value. Default value is Null

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Flip
member.summary: Specifies the axis used to flip the image.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Flip.None
member.summary: Specifies no flipping.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Flip.X
member.summary: Specifies a horizontal flip.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Flip.Y
member.summary: Specifies a vertical flip.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Flip.XY
member.summary: Specifies a horizontal and vertical flip.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.LockAspectRatio
member.summary: Specifies how image's proportions are maintained.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.LockAspectRatio.None
member.summary: Specifies that image's proportions are not maintained.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.LockAspectRatio.WidthBased
member.summary: Specifies that image's proportions are maintained based on the new width value.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.LockAspectRatio.HeightBased
member.summary: Specifies that image's proportions are maintained based on the new height value.

member.name: T:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DitherMethod
member.summary: Specifies the dithering method to be used for Black/White conversion.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DitherMethod.Threshold
member.summary: Any pixel below the threshold becomes black; otherwise it becomes white. Use it for logos or simple images.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DitherMethod.PatternDiffusion
member.summary: It uses a 4x4 dithering matrix to create a grouping of pixels that approximates the pixel group brightness. Use it for photos and other complicated images.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DitherMethod.FloydSteinberg
member.summary: It uses Floyd-Steinberg algorithm to keep a track of the error in brightness caused by the threshold, and diffusing it across an area. Use it for photos and other complicated images.

member.name: F:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.DitherMethod.OtsuThreshold
member.summary: It uses Otsu's method to automatically perform histogram shape-based image thresholding. Use it for logos or simple images.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.PrintDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: It prints a label listing barcodes, objects stored in DRAM, or fonts.
member.param: The directory info. It includes the printer's memory device, object name and extensions. Wildcard characters like question mark and asterisk can be used. For example, "R:*.*" will print all objects stored in Printer DRAM memory.

remarks.para: This method lets you to print a label listing barcodes, objects stored in DRAM, or fonts.

- For barcodes, the list shows the name of the bar code. - For fonts, the list shows the name of the font, the alphanumeric character identifier, and size. - For objects stored in DRAM, the list shows the name of the object, extension, size, and option flags.

The different drives of a Zebra thermal printer are the following: - R: Printer DRAM Library - B: Optional Memory (A card or factory installed) - E: Flash memory - A: Compact flash memory - Z: Internal ZPL II stored object library (Read-only)

The following is a list of commonly used object extensions found in a Zebra thermal printer: - .FNT: Font objects - .BAR: Barcode objects - .GRF: Graphic objects in Zebra image format - .PNG: Graphic objects in Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format. - * (asterik): For all objects

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.PrintConfiguration
member.summary: It prints the printer configuration label. The printer configuration label contains information about the printer setup, such as sensor type, network ID, ZPL mode, firmware version, and descriptive data on the R:, E:, B:, and A: devices.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.DeleteObject(System.String)
member.summary: It deletes objects, graphics, fonts, and stored formats from printer's storage areas. Objects can be deleted selectively or in groups.
member.param: The object info to be deleted/removed. The info includes the printer's memory device where the object is stored as well as the object name and extension. The asterisk (*) character can be used as a wildcard allowing you to easily delete a selected group of objects.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.CopyObject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: It is used to copy an object or group of objects from one storage device to another. It is similar to the copy function used in PCs.
member.param: The info of the stored object which will be copied. The info includes the printer's memory device where the object is stored as well as the object name and extension. The asterisk (*) character can be used as a wildcard allowing you to easily copy a selected group of objects.

The info for the destination object. The info includes the printer's memory device where the object will be stored as well as the object name and extension. The asterisk (*) character can be used as a wildcard.

remarks.para: - If the destination device does not have enough free space to store the object being copied, the task is canceled.
- Zebra files (Z:*.*) cannot be transferred. These files are copyrighted by Zebra Technologies.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.ResetPrinter
member.summary: It resets all of the printer's internal software, performs a power-on self-test (POST), clears the buffer and DRAM, and resets communication parameters and default values. This method performs the same function as a manual power-on reset.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.SetPrinterFactoryConfiguration
member.summary: It reloads the printer's factory configuration.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.SetDarkness(System.Double)
member.summary: It adjusts the darkness relative to the current darkness setting.
member.param: - For ZPL printers: The darkness level which must range from -30 to 30, depending on current value of printer settings. NOTE: The darkness level for the XiIIIPlus printer must be 0 to 30 in increments of 0.1. - For EPL printers: The darkness level which must range from 0 to 15.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.SetPrintMode(Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintMode)
member.summary: It determines the action the printer takes after a label or group of labels has printed.
member.param: The print mode. Be sure to select the appropriate value for the print mode being used to avoid unexpected results. Note that not all printers support all options. Please refer to the printer user manual for further details.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.CutLabel
member.summary: It cuts the label when the printer is in the Delayed Cutter PRINT MODE.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.SetMediaTracking(Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MediaTracking)
member.summary: It sets the type of media used (continuous or non-continuous) for purposes of tracking.
member.param: The media to use (continuous or non-continuous) for purposes of tracking.

remarks.para: The types of media can be categorized as follows:

- Continuous Media: this media has no physical characteristic (web, notch, perforation, mark, et cetera) to separate labels. The Label length is determined by the height property of a ThermalLabel object. - Non-continuous Media: this media has some type of physical characteristic (web, notch, perforation, mark, et cetera) to separate the labels.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.SetMediaType(Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.MediaType)
member.summary: It selects the type of media being used (Thermal Transfer or Direct Thermal) in the printer.
member.param: The type of media to use for printing.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.PausePrinting
member.summary: It stops printing after the current label is complete (if one is printing) and places the printer in Pause Mode.

remarks.para: The effect of this method is not immediate. Therefore, several labels might print before a pause is performed. The operation is identical to pressing PAUSE on the control panel of the printer. The printer remains paused until PAUSE is pressed or a call to "StartPrinting" method.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintUtils.StartPrinting
member.summary: It causes a printer in Pause Mode to resume printing.

remarks.para: The operation is identical to pressing PAUSE on the control panel of the printer when the printer is already in Pause Mode.

member.name: P:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.PrintJob.BufferOutput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to buffer output printer commands. When the printer commands are buffered, the print job does not send them to the printer until the print job has been processed, or until the BufferFlush method is invoked. Default value is false i.e. the output is not buffered but sent to the printer while processing the print job.

member.name: M:Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Font.GetNearestSizeForNativePrinterFonts(Neodynamic.SDK.Printing.Font)
member.summary: Gets the nearest fixed size for the specified Font object. The Font object should be one of the supported Native Printer Fonts.
member.param: The Font object on which the nearest fixed size is calculated.
member.returns: The nearest fixed size for the specified Font object.

remarks.para: Native Printer Fonts accept the following fixed sizes:
- NativePrinterFontS: 3pt (this font does support just this value only)
- NativePrinterFontA: 5pt, 10pt, 15pt, 20pt, and 25pt
- NativePrinterFontB: 7pt, 14pt, 21pt, 28pt, and 35pt
By using this method, you can get the nearest fixed size if the specified Font object has a different value for the font size.
